title: YKF organizes an activity to observe Right to Self-Determination Day
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 05 (APP):The Youth Forum for Kashmir (YKF) on Wednesday organized a day long activity at Centaurus Mall, Islamabad, to mark Right to Self-Determination Day.
Kashmiris around the world are observing this Right to Self-Determination Day to make the international community realize that their promise to the people of Indian Illegally Occupied Jammu and Kashmir (IIOJK) remains unfulfilled.
In these last seven decades, three generations of Kashmiris have suffered at the hands of Indian occupation forces, waiting for the actualization of UN’s promise to them.
The daylong campaign titled “Remembering United Nations Plebiscite Resolution on Kashmir” aimed to promote and raise awareness of the ultimate resolution of the long pending issue of Indian Illegally Occupied Jammu & Kashmir (IIOJK).
The event was held at the main lobby of Centaurus Mall, Islamabad, Young men and women from YFK joined visitors gathered at an attractive Selfie Wall.
The resolution adopted by the United Nations Commission for India and Pakistan, on 5 Jan. 1949, is marked as Kashmir Self-Determination Day.
YFK–International Kashmir Lobby Group is an independent NGO working in the region and internationally for the peaceful resolution of Kashmir Conflict in accordance with United Nations Security Council resolutions.
